pros: Great place to work, friendly people
cons: Office not very centrally located in UK

pros: Great team, and the pay is great.
cons: Not really a con, because its expected.. it can be very demanding in the sense of getting sponsors, and it can feel like you're working for a business rather than a charity.

pros: On-going training and support. Variety of places to work in. Friendly and helpful colleagues. Working for a good deed.
cons: Unpaid break. Far away locations at times. For the interview process, other candidates received more information, had a bit of a disadvantage but still got the job.

review_title: Very nice charity to work for

pros: Does great work overseas, well managed, reaches hardest to reach populations, lots of deeply committed staff, good learning and development opportunities.
cons: Big organisation internationally, difficult to influence or change systems, processes - not impossible though!

review_title: Tough job but amazing supportive team
job_title: Senior Street Fundraiser and Team Leader in London, England
pros:
Lots of support and a great management team

Working with other amazing team leaders and meeting so many fascinating people

Opportinities to both team lead and fundraise.
cons: Fundraising can be a taxing job, team leading also depending on the weather

review_title: Great to  work where you believe in the mission
job_title: Head of International Support in London, England
pros: Passion for alleviating human suffering in the global south
cons: Big NGOs are unwieldy and slow to change

job_title: London Office Employee in London, England
pros: Just speaking for the London office here but it is definitely the friendliest and most rewarding place I’ve ever worked in. Very supportive management and good team atmosphere, everyone works together really well and not too hierarchical. Everyone committed but relaxed and we have good fun. Great job satisfaction from supporting an amazing cause.
cons: Not many shops and cafes nearby but beautiful river views makes up for it a bit.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Belfast, Northern Ireland
pros: As an international organisation it is one of the best. Overseas work is first class, Dublin office a completely different (and better) culture/atmosphere than UK.
cons: Decisions made without justification, rules bent for more senior management lead to very low morale, poor middle management and organisation structure in UK fundraising teams.. No investment in staff or thought for future progression. High staff turnover.

pros:
- Amazing informative staff days, where you really feel a part of the charity
- Opportunity for progression to TL if you work hard and well
- Regular feedback
- Developed great soft skills
cons:
- Challanging at first
- Can be unpleasant as you need to work in all weathers
- Can get unpleasant responses on the street

pros:
-Great values and work environment
-Dynamic and active job
-Occasional travel around the UK
-Good pay and flexible work options 
-Amazing cause to work for
cons:
-Physically (and emotionally) challenging
-Work in different locations every day 
-Not great career progression options

pros:
- Self-fulfilling.
- Motivational.
- Support from Team Leaders.
cons:
- Rejection.
- The lack of manners from the public.
- The weather.

pros: Amazing community to be part of makes a massive difference to so much lives
cons: Was quite difficult when initially starting off

pros: Good office environment, good attempts at boosting office morale and communication between offices
cons: Absolutely none, great organisation to work for

pros:
